summary: This document is a compilation of prison incident reports and administrative records from the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) concerning inmate Jeffrey Epstein and his cellmate Nicholas Tartaglione. It details an incident on July 23, 2019, where Epstein was found with a homemade rope around his neck, and other administrative actions for both inmates.

persons.name: Jeffrey Edward Epstein
persons.context: The primary inmate of interest, found with a homemade rope around his neck on July 23, 2019, and placed on suicide watch.

persons.name: Nicholas John Tartaglione
persons.context: Epstein's cellmate at the time of the July 23, 2019 incident. Also cited for separate infractions including possession of a cellphone and suspected drugs.

connections.description: Were housed together in the same cell (Unit 9 North) at the Metropolitan Correctional Center when the July 23, 2019 incident occurred.

events.title: Epstein Found with Homemade Rope
events.description: Inmate Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell with a homemade rope around his neck. The incident was classified as a suicide attempt/self-mutilation and prompted a pending DHO hearing.

events.title: Drugs Found on Inmate Smith
events.description: Staff recovered a small paper with a green leafy substance from an inmate named Smith, which tested positive for amphetamine. The incident report was suspended.

events.title: Cellphone Found on Tartaglione
events.description: Staff conducting a pat search recovered a cellphone that had fallen to the floor from inmate Nicholas Tartaglione.

events.title: Tartaglione DHO Sanction
events.description: Nicholas Tartaglione was sanctioned by a Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) for possession of a cellphone, with the sanction period running from August 1 to September 14, 2019.

keyFacts: On July 23, 2019, Jeffrey Epstein was found in his cell at MCC with a homemade rope around his neck, an incident documented as a suicide attempt/self-mutilation.
Epstein's cellmate at the time of the incident was Nicholas John Tartaglione (Reg. No. 78514-054).
The document references a pending Disciplinary Hearing Officer (DHO) case for Epstein related to the July 23 incident under code 228 (self-mutilation).
Separate from the Epstein incident, Tartaglione was sanctioned for possession of a cellphone found on July 2, 2019.
The document is part of a larger case file (Case Number: NYM-19-0061, Type: Threat Assessment) where interviews had been concluded.
